comment:
Dry Lectures: Read off the slides (which were not his) but didn't explain the content; Used old COVID lectures. Unreachable (didn't respond to TAs/Students email or any communication platform). Class directed by other section professors. Input incorrect transcript grades for everyone.

He disappeared from his the section and Junior Design. AVOID!!!

Absolutely terrible.  Class was canceled left and right, basically moved from in person to online.  Incredibly dry when lecturing, just repeats from the slides.  Unreliable in releasing assignments, announces they will be released one day but they won't show up for a week.  Doesn't respond to student emails either.  10/10 don't recommend.
This course was taken for Junior Design. The class moves quickly, but Dr. Lively and his co-instructor made the time beneficial. The class structure is confusing, so that should be improved.

This class was difficult during the pandemic. Dr. Lively was very flexible with assignment submissions and allowed for late submissions with no penalty. The concepts are hard, but he was good at providing examples to better understand mobile app development.

Unreliable professor. Lectures uploaded randomly and rarely on time. Lectures themselves were usually the professor reading off of slides, and seemed very disinterested. Grading was confusing and often contradictory. Course was disorganized, overall poor experience.

I was nervous about taking a programming course, but Dr. Lively made learning the syntax easy. Going to class was important because Dr. Lively focused on hands-on programming exercises, which made doing the assignments a lot easier.

I took Dr. Lively for this course. Although he was a little late with the grading, he was easy to contact via email. I also was able to make office hours appointments for assignments that I did not understand.

First time having this professor and it was in an online class. Professor stopped posting/contacting students after the 4th week of class. Zero updates, zero discussion responses, and zero grades returned. Professor also failed to submit grades by the deadline at the end of the semester. Left feedback on assignments only after end of semester.

This class was tough mainly due to the fact it was completely self-study and the professor did not have any lectures. Also, it was hard to get feedback from him on things such as missed quiz/test questions, general questions, etc. Professor seemed to be very hands-off in the course, which was not good given the difficulty of the subject material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS
